column4: let's see... what nice things should go into a rescue initrd?  fdisk and ntfsresize... what else?  hrm...
I suppose for a more general rescue image... but I only use ext2 for /boot... and I might stop doing that at some point...
I also don't have a floppy drive... they are obsolete piles of shit and I'm glad to see them go
I wrote a floppy disk driver once for ReactOS... man they suck
I hate floppies with a passion
you can hardly EAT for $20... if you aren't a starving cambodian, you can afford a usb memory stick ;)
that reminds me... I should go buy one of those
I usually just use cds or the Internet
why would you need a stick....there is sftp...
what were you trying to mount?
sounds like the cd is unreadable... dmesg should be full of errors
reboot, and try a different cd
it isn't killable because the kernel is shitting itself
my guess is that the drive does not like dma mode or something
OK, well, at least my hdd got umounted, that is an improvement.
